bwwExcerpt: Natasha and Pierre is fun, even if-for quite long stretches-its infectious, enveloping noise and bustle appear to be the sum of its parts. The title is as busy as the two-and-a-half hour production, which focuses on the perils in love as experienced by Natasha (the wonderful Den√©e Benton, in her Broadway debut). Her true love, stolid soldier Andrey (Nicholas Belton) is away fighting-and instead swings across her radar the swaggering cad Anatole (Lucas Steele). So who will she choose? Max McGuinn
